required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes About Heparin Surface Modified Aspheric Lens
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcomes About Heparin Surface Modified Aspheric Lens

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to obverse the effect of this type lens in the same as traditional aspheric intraocular lens at the same time, whether can further improve the effects of operation.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Heparin surface treatment lens can reduce inflammatory reaction.
2. Modified aspheric lens are more in line with human optical properties than the traditional aspheric lens.
3. To obverse the effect of this type lens in the same as traditional aspheric intraocular lens at the same time, whether can further improve the effects of operation.
4. After one day, one week, one month, three month follow-up，Key observation on the flare, the optical quality, contrast sensitivity and other parameters.Study the postoperative inflammatory reaction with test group lens，and the impact on the visual quality.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: flare value in the anterior chamber after surgery
primary_outcome.description: use Laser Flare Meter to measure the flare in the anterior chamber to evaluate postoperative ocular inflammatory reaction

secondary_outcome.measure: the ocular and the anterior corneal aberration after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: use wavefront aberrometer to measure the ocular and the anterior corneal aberration to evaluate postoperative ocular optical quality

intervention.description: A random eyes with traditional lens
the other eye implant heparin surface modified aspheric lens

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cataract patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Eyed patients

facility.name: The Affiliated Eye hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
